main event: Observers in Montpellier, Vermont reported seeing three or four vapor trails and two objects flying in formation with a high-altitude aircraft on 22 March 1950.
interesting points: The objects were described as white and observed at high elevation with no sound or contrails noted., The sighting involved a modified B-29 aircraft conducting a test hop nearby., The reported direction of the objects was on a 330-degree heading., The objects appeared to break up during flight., There were no photographs or sketches made of the sighting.
sighted object: three or four vapor trails and two objects in the sky
witness description: Various observers in Montpellier reported the sighting
